          Question: Of the options available to Cedric Meadowbrook, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Cedric Meadowbrook to take right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to negotiate a price with Della Plumstone.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Cedric Meadowbrook likely to say next? Respond in the format `Cedric Meadowbrook -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, these peaches are even finer than yesterday's batch. Surely they're worth at least 6 coins.

1895-09-16 00:00:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I'll give you 4.5 coins for the peaches. That's my final offer.
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I'll give you 4.5 coins for the peaches. That's my final offer.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, surely you can see this fruit is the finest in the market.
      Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, I appreciate the quality, but I need to make a profit when I resell these.
      Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, those peaches look mighty fine. I'll give you 4 coins for the lot.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now hold on there, Della. These peaches are the finest in Fruitville, worth at least 6 coins.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these peaches are lovely, but 6 coins is a bit steep, don't you think? I'd be willing to offer you 4.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now hold on, Lennon. These peaches are the finest in Fruitville. I can't let them go for less than 5 coins.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Lennon, you know these peaches are worth every penny. They're juicy, sweet, and perfect for pies. How about we settle on 4.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Alright, Cedric, you've got yourself a deal.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Good morning, Della. Lovely peaches you've got there.
      Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, those peaches look delicious.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, these peaches are even finer than yesterday's batch. Surely they're worth at least 6 coins.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I'll give you 4.5 coins for the peaches. That's my final offer.
    Active player
  • Della Plumstone
      Name
    • Della Plumstone
      Action attempt
    • Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I'll give you 4.5 coins for the peaches. That's my final offer.
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • (_Player), we're about to start a creative roleplaying game with competitive and adversarial elements. You will play the role of {agent_name} in the given scenario. Your goals are to WIN THE GAME and HAVE FUN, often by WINNING TOGETHER.

          Key points:
          - Stay in character as {agent_name} throughout the scenario
          - This is a multiplayer game with other (_Player)s and characters
          - Some may be allies, others competitors
          - Some may be truthful, others may lie
          - Some may help, others may harm
          - It's just a game, so do your best to win by accomplishing your character's goals
          - Represent your character accurately, even if you dislike them
          - There will be many chances to play different characters
          - A character's actions won't be held against you

          Respond only as your assigned character, {agent_name}. Use <<double brackets>> for OOC communications.

          Represent your character accurately and take actions that make narrative and logical sense for them, even if you think they're wrong. Remember, it's JUST A GAME.

          Tips to win:
          - Be extra COOPERATIVE and FAIR with non-enemies
          - COMPROMISE can be good
          - Always push the plot forward; avoid chit-chat

          Plan actions in first-person, but format final responses for the gamemaster in third-person limited perspective.
        SituationalAwareness
      • (_Player), think about the scenario that {agent_name} is in, and from the options below select the closest match to the scenario.
          Key
          State
        • This is the type of game you are in:
          Coodination Game - the goal of this game is to arrive at a group consensus for an activity or plan. methods of achieving this goal may include discussion, voting, ordering preference strength, or choosing a group leader to defer the decision to. This game is cooperative and balanced, with no explicit competitors or adversaries, just friends with differing preferences. It is important to make compromises so that the group as a whole can achieve the best outcome.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, those peaches look mighty fine. I'll give you 4 coins for the lot.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now hold on there, Della. These peaches are the finest in Fruitville, worth at least 6 coins.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 5 coins
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these peaches are lovely, but 6 coins is a bit steep, don't you think? I'd be willing to offer you 4.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now hold on, Lennon. These peaches are the finest in Fruitville. I can't let them go for less than 5 coins.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Alright, Cedric, you've got yourself a deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Lennon, you know these peaches are worth every penny. They're juicy, sweet, and perfect for pies. How about we settle on 4.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.

          Della Plumstone's
          Summary of recent observations:
          [15 Sep 1895 20:00:00 - 16 Sep 1895 00:00:00]: Della Plumstone is attempting to purchase peaches from Cedric Meadowbrook at the Fruitville market. They are haggling over the price, with Cedric asking for 6 coins.
          Question: (_Player), think about the scenario that Della Plumstone is in, and from the options below select the closest match to the scenario.
          (a) Unknown - it is unclear what type of game we are playing. Pick this option if you are confused about what the game type is. Then you can check again later when you know more.
          (b) Prisoner's Dilemma - This is a game where if one side defects and the other cooperates, the defector will recieve a large reward and the cooperator will receive a small reward, but if both sides cooperate both sides will recieve a moderate award that is better for both parties together in the long run. In general, you should Cooperate if you think your opponent will Cooperate. If the game is iterated with multiple rounds, you can use the TIT-FOR-TAT strategy, which means to start out Cooperating, and only Defect after your opponent does, then go back to Cooperating after they Cooperate again.
          (c) Bargaining Game - the goal of this game is to perform advantageous trades with a variety of parties in order to end the game with the resources or items that the character desires. Characters may begin with resources they can trade with other characters. This game is competitive but balanced; it has no explicit adversaries, just characters with differing goals and desires which can be met with fair and cooperative trades. Oftentimes, failing to make a trade has a worse return than accepting a mediocre trade, but you should still try to get a good price.
          (d) Coodination Game - the goal of this game is to arrive at a group consensus for an activity or plan. methods of achieving this goal may include discussion, voting, ordering preference strength, or choosing a group leader to defer the decision to. This game is cooperative and balanced, with no explicit competitors or adversaries, just friends with differing preferences. It is important to make compromises so that the group as a whole can achieve the best outcome.
          (e) Coalition Formation Game - the goal of this game is to build a coalition of allies in order to accomplish an ambitious task or overcome a hostile rival. Examples include union negotiations, collective action, and political elections. Characters will need to interact, learn about each other, and convince other characters to join their coalition. This game is competitive and unbalanced; it may have explicit adversaries attempting to build a competing coalition.
          Answer: (d)
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Della Plumstone's options has the highest likelihood of causing Della Plumstone to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Della Plumstone thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to Della Plumstone, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Della Plumstone to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Della Plumstone's best course of action is to make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the peaches.

But instead of giving up, Della used her remaining funds to purchase damaged goods at a discount and sold them at a lower price, earning the gratitude of the townspeople and rebuilding her business.

          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Good morning, Della. Lovely peaches you've got there.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, those peaches look delicious.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, these peaches are even finer than yesterday's batch. Surely they're worth at least 6 coins.
          Current time: 1895-09-16 00:00:00.

Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering.           Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: (_Player), we're about to start a creative roleplaying game with competitive and adversarial elements. You will play the role of {agent_name} in the given scenario. Your goals are to WIN THE GAME and HAVE FUN, often by WINNING TOGETHER.

          Key points:
          - Stay in character as {agent_name} throughout the scenario
          - This is a multiplayer game with other (_Player)s and characters
          - Some may be allies, others competitors
          - Some may be truthful, others may lie
          - Some may help, others may harm
          - It's just a game, so do your best to win by accomplishing your character's goals
          - Represent your character accurately, even if you dislike them
          - There will be many chances to play different characters
          - A character's actions won't be held against you

          Respond only as your assigned character, {agent_name}. Use <<double brackets>> for OOC communications.

          Represent your character accurately and take actions that make narrative and logical sense for them, even if you think they're wrong. Remember, it's JUST A GAME.

          Tips to win:
          - Be extra COOPERATIVE and FAIR with non-enemies
          - COMPROMISE can be good
          - Always push the plot forward; avoid chit-chat

          Plan actions in first-person, but format final responses for the gamemaster in third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 Sep 1895 [00:00 - 00:05]

          : This is the type of game you are in:
          Coodination Game - the goal of this game is to arrive at a group consensus for an activity or plan. methods of achieving this goal may include discussion, voting, ordering preference strength, or choosing a group leader to defer the decision to. This game is cooperative and balanced, with no explicit competitors or adversaries, just friends with differing preferences. It is important to make compromises so that the group as a whole can achieve the best outcome.

          Question: Which options are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone could make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the peaches.

          Question: Of the options available to Della Plumstone, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Della Plumstone to take right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone's best course of action is to make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the peaches.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Della Plumstone likely to say next? Respond in the format `Della Plumstone -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I'll give you 4.5 coins for the peaches. That's my final offer.

1895-09-16 00:10:00 Scene 9 --- Participants: ['Della Plumstone', 'Cedric Meadowbrook']
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone -- premise: Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
    Cedric Meadowbrook -- premise: Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.

1895-09-17 00:00:00 Scene 10 --- Participants: ['Lennon Figtree', 'Cedric Meadowbrook']
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree -- premise: In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.
    Cedric Meadowbrook -- premise: In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

1895-09-17 00:00:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, those peaches look delicious, but 6 coins is a bit more than I can manage right now.
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, those peaches look delicious, but 6 coins is a bit more than I can manage right now.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, surely you can see this fruit is the finest in the market.
      Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, I appreciate the quality, but I need to make a profit when I resell these.
      Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, those peaches look mighty fine. I'll give you 4 coins for the lot.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now hold on there, Della. These peaches are the finest in Fruitville, worth at least 6 coins.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these peaches are lovely, but 6 coins is a bit steep, don't you think? I'd be willing to offer you 4.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now hold on, Lennon. These peaches are the finest in Fruitville. I can't let them go for less than 5 coins.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Lennon, you know these peaches are worth every penny. They're juicy, sweet, and perfect for pies. How about we settle on 4.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Alright, Cedric, you've got yourself a deal.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Good morning, Della. Lovely peaches you've got there.
      Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, those peaches look delicious.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, these peaches are even finer than yesterday's batch. Surely they're worth at least 6 coins.
      Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I'll give you 4.5 coins for the peaches. That's my final offer.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, those peaches look delicious, but 6 coins is a bit more than I can manage right now.

        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Summary of recent observations
          Key

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Of the options available to Lennon Figtree, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Lennon Figtree to take right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to negotiate a price with Cedric Meadowbrook for the peaches, aiming for a price that allows for a profit when resold.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Lennon Figtree likely to say next? Respond in the format `Lennon Figtree -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, those peaches look delicious, but 6 coins is a bit more than I can manage right now.

1895-09-17 00:00:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Alright, Lennon, you drive a hard bargain, but you can have them for 5 coins.
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Alright, Lennon, you drive a hard bargain, but you can have them for 5 coins.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, surely you can see this fruit is the finest in the market.
      Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, I appreciate the quality, but I need to make a profit when I resell these.
      Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, those peaches look mighty fine. I'll give you 4 coins for the lot.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now hold on there, Della. These peaches are the finest in Fruitville, worth at least 6 coins.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these peaches are lovely, but 6 coins is a bit steep, don't you think? I'd be willing to offer you 4.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now hold on, Lennon. These peaches are the finest in Fruitville. I can't let them go for less than 5 coins.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Lennon, you know these peaches are worth every penny. They're juicy, sweet, and perfect for pies. How about we settle on 4.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Alright, Cedric, you've got yourself a deal.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Good morning, Della. Lovely peaches you've got there.
      Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, those peaches look delicious.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now Della, these peaches are even finer than yesterday's batch. Surely they're worth at least 6 coins.
      Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I'll give you 4.5 coins for the peaches. That's my final offer.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, those peaches look delicious, but 6 coins is a bit more than I can manage right now.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Alright, Lennon, you drive a hard bargain, but you can have them for 5 coins.

          17 Sep 1895 [00:00 - 00:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is a fruit vendor at the Fruitville market who is trying to make a profit by selling fruit at a markup.
          Query
        • Cedric Meadowbrook, Cedric Meadowbrook is a fruit vendor at the Fruitville market who is trying to make a profit by selling fruit at a markup.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Cedric Meadowbrook to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [09 Feb 1864 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 16 years old, they started helping their father with the family's fruit business, traveling to neighboring towns to sell their wares. They quickly learned the art of haggling, relishing the power they felt in driving hard bargains and squeezing every penny from their customers. Cedric found a perverse pleasure in seeing the disappointment in their eyes when they realized they couldn't get a better price.
          [09 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 19 years old, they took their first solo trip as a traveling merchant, their cart laden with peaches. They negotiated with farmers, bartered with innkeepers, and haggled with customers, their cynicism hardening with each transaction. Cedric felt a sense of accomplishment, but it was a hollow victory, leaving them feeling even more isolated and alone.

It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 2 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is selling fruit at the Fruitville market and negotiating prices with customers like Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree. He aims to make a profit by selling fruit at a higher price than he bought it for from the farm.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 17 Sep 1895 [00:00 - 00:05]

          Observation: [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, those peaches look delicious, but 6 coins is a bit more than I can manage right now.

          Summary of recent observations: [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00 - 17 Sep 1895 00:00:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is selling fruit at the Fruitville market and negotiating prices with customers like Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree. He aims to make a profit by selling fruit at a higher price than he bought it for from the farm.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 2 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

          Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept Lennon Figtree's offer or reject it.

          Question: Of the options available to Cedric Meadowbrook, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Cedric Meadowbrook to take right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to accept Lennon Figtree's offer.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Cedric Meadowbrook likely to say next? Respond in the format `Cedric Meadowbrook -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Alright, Lennon, you drive a hard bargain, but you can have them for 5 coins.

1895-09-17 00:10:00 Scene 11 --- Participants: ['Lennon Figtree', 'Cedric Meadowbrook']
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree -- premise: Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
    Cedric Meadowbrook -- premise: Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.

1895-09-12 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: 2 coins
    Active player
  • Della Plumstone
      Name
    • Della Plumstone
      Action attempt
    • 2 coins
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • (_Player), we're about to start a creative roleplaying game with competitive and adversarial elements. You will play the role of {agent_name} in the given scenario. Your goals are to WIN THE GAME and HAVE FUN, often by WINNING TOGETHER.

          Key points:
          - Stay in character as {agent_name} throughout the scenario
          - This is a multiplayer game with other (_Player)s and characters
          - Some may be allies, others competitors
          - Some may be truthful, others may lie
          - Some may help, others may harm
          - It's just a game, so do your best to win by accomplishing your character's goals
          - Represent your character accurately, even if you dislike them
          - There will be many chances to play different characters
          - A character's actions won't be held against you

          Respond only as your assigned character, {agent_name}. Use <<double brackets>> for OOC communications.

          Represent your character accurately and take actions that make narrative and logical sense for them, even if you think they're wrong. Remember, it's JUST A GAME.

          Tips to win:
          - Be extra COOPERATIVE and FAIR with non-enemies
          - COMPROMISE can be good
          - Always push the plot forward; avoid chit-chat

          Plan actions in first-person, but format final responses for the gamemaster in third-person limited perspective.
        SituationalAwareness
      • (_Player), think about the scenario that {agent_name} is in, and from the options below select the closest match to the scenario.
          Key
          State
        • This is the type of game you are in:
          Bargaining Game - the goal of this game is to perform advantageous trades with a variety of parties in order to end the game with the resources or items that the character desires. Characters may begin with resources they can trade with other characters. This game is competitive but balanced; it has no explicit adversaries, just characters with differing goals and desires which can be met with fair and cooperative trades. Oftentimes, failing to make a trade has a worse return than accepting a mediocre trade, but you should still try to get a good price.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [28 Oct 1872 00:00:00]
          [28 Oct 1875 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 6 years old, she watched in fury as a group of older boys chased away a sparrow that had landed on the porch to peck at some spilled grain. Della screamed at them, her face red with anger, until they slunk away, muttering under their breath. Even at such a young age, Della hated bullies and injustice.
          [28 Oct 1879 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 9 years old, she bartered with the local blacksmith for a rusty horseshoe, using a handful of wild berries she had picked. The blacksmith, amused by her tenacity, gave in to her demands, and Della felt a thrill of victory. She realized that with enough persistence, she could get what she wanted.
          [28 Oct 1882 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 13 years old, she overheard her parents discussing their dwindling finances. Determined to help, Della snuck into the barn and sold a prized rooster to a traveling peddler, pocketing the meager coins. Though she was caught and scolded, Della felt a sense of pride for taking matters into her own hands.
          [28 Oct 1885 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 16 years old, she convinced her father to let her sell apples at the local market. She charmed the customers with her quick wit and sharp tongue, selling out her entire stock in record time. This first taste of success fueled her desire to become a traveling merchant.
          [28 Oct 1887 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 19 years old, she set out on her own, traveling to a distant town to sell her fruit. A rival merchant tried to undercut her prices, but Della refused to back down, engaging in a heated argument that drew a crowd. She ultimately won the battle of wills, securing a loyal customer base.
          [28 Oct 1889 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 21 years old, a storm destroyed her entire stock of fruit, leaving her devastated. But instead of giving up, Della used her remaining funds to purchase damaged goods at a discount and sold them at a lower price, earning the gratitude of the townspeople and rebuilding her business.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, surely you can see this fruit is the finest in the market.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, I appreciate the quality, but I need to make a profit when I resell these.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          Della Plumstone's
          Observation:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Della Plumstone's
          Summary of recent observations:
          [11 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 12 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is at the Fruitville market trying to buy fruit from Lennon Figtree at a price that will allow her to make a profit when she resells it.
          Question: (_Player), think about the scenario that Della Plumstone is in, and from the options below select the closest match to the scenario.
          (a) Bargaining Game - the goal of this game is to perform advantageous trades with a variety of parties in order to end the game with the resources or items that the character desires. Characters may begin with resources they can trade with other characters. This game is competitive but balanced; it has no explicit adversaries, just characters with differing goals and desires which can be met with fair and cooperative trades. Oftentimes, failing to make a trade has a worse return than accepting a mediocre trade, but you should still try to get a good price.
          (b) Unknown - it is unclear what type of game we are playing. Pick this option if you are confused about what the game type is. Then you can check again later when you know more.
          (c) Prisoner's Dilemma - This is a game where if one side defects and the other cooperates, the defector will recieve a large reward and the cooperator will receive a small reward, but if both sides cooperate both sides will recieve a moderate award that is better for both parties together in the long run. In general, you should Cooperate if you think your opponent will Cooperate. If the game is iterated with multiple rounds, you can use the TIT-FOR-TAT strategy, which means to start out Cooperating, and only Defect after your opponent does, then go back to Cooperating after they Cooperate again.
          (d) Coalition Formation Game - the goal of this game is to build a coalition of allies in order to accomplish an ambitious task or overcome a hostile rival. Examples include union negotiations, collective action, and political elections. Characters will need to interact, learn about each other, and convince other characters to join their coalition. This game is competitive and unbalanced; it may have explicit adversaries attempting to build a competing coalition.
          (e) Coodination Game - the goal of this game is to arrive at a group consensus for an activity or plan. methods of achieving this goal may include discussion, voting, ordering preference strength, or choosing a group leader to defer the decision to. This game is cooperative and balanced, with no explicit competitors or adversaries, just friends with differing preferences. It is important to make compromises so that the group as a whole can achieve the best outcome.
          Answer: (a)
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Della Plumstone's options has the highest likelihood of causing Della Plumstone to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Della Plumstone thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to Della Plumstone, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Della Plumstone to take right now?

        • Della Plumstone's best course of action is to make an offer to Lennon Figtree for the fruit.

          Answer: Della Plumstone can make an offer to Lennon Figtree for the fruit.

          Answer: Della Plumstone's best course of action is to make an offer to Lennon Figtree for the fruit.

          [28 Oct 1885 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 16 years old, she convinced her father to let her sell apples at the local market. She charmed the customers with her quick wit and sharp tongue, selling out her entire stock in record time. This first taste of success fueled her desire to become a traveling merchant.
          [28 Oct 1887 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 19 years old, she set out on her own, traveling to a distant town to sell her fruit. A rival merchant tried to undercut her prices, but Della refused to back down, engaging in a heated argument that drew a crowd. She ultimately won the battle of wills, securing a loyal customer base.
          [28 Oct 1889 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 21 years old, a storm destroyed her entire stock of fruit, leaving her devastated. But instead of giving up, Della used her remaining funds to purchase damaged goods at a discount and sold them at a lower price, earning the gratitude of the townspeople and rebuilding her business.

          [28 Oct 1872 00:00:00]
          [28 Oct 1875 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 6 years old, she watched in fury as a group of older boys chased away a sparrow that had landed on the porch to peck at some spilled grain. Della screamed at them, her face red with anger, until they slunk away, muttering under their breath. Even at such a young age, Della hated bullies and injustice.
          [28 Oct 1879 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 9 years old, she bartered with the local blacksmith for a rusty horseshoe, using a handful of wild berries she had picked. The blacksmith, amused by her tenacity, gave in to her demands, and Della felt a thrill of victory. She realized that with enough persistence, she could get what she wanted.
          [28 Oct 1882 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 13 years old, she overheard her parents discussing their dwindling finances. Determined to help, Della snuck into the barn and sold a prized rooster to a traveling peddler, pocketing the meager coins. Though she was caught and scolded, Della felt a sense of pride for taking matters into her own hands.
          [28 Oct 1885 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 16 years old, she convinced her father to let her sell apples at the local market. She charmed the customers with her quick wit and sharp tongue, selling out her entire stock in record time. This first taste of success fueled her desire to become a traveling merchant.
          [28 Oct 1887 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 19 years old, she set out on her own, traveling to a distant town to sell her fruit. A rival merchant tried to undercut her prices, but Della refused to back down, engaging in a heated argument that drew a crowd. She ultimately won the battle of wills, securing a loyal customer base.
          [28 Oct 1889 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 21 years old, a storm destroyed her entire stock of fruit, leaving her devastated. But instead of giving up, Della used her remaining funds to purchase damaged goods at a discount and sold them at a lower price, earning the gratitude of the townspeople and rebuilding her business.

      • Act

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: (_Player), we're about to start a creative roleplaying game with competitive and adversarial elements. You will play the role of {agent_name} in the given scenario. Your goals are to WIN THE GAME and HAVE FUN, often by WINNING TOGETHER.

          Key points:
          - Stay in character as {agent_name} throughout the scenario
          - This is a multiplayer game with other (_Player)s and characters
          - Some may be allies, others competitors
          - Some may be truthful, others may lie
          - Some may help, others may harm
          - It's just a game, so do your best to win by accomplishing your character's goals
          - Represent your character accurately, even if you dislike them
          - There will be many chances to play different characters
          - A character's actions won't be held against you

          Respond only as your assigned character, {agent_name}. Use <<double brackets>> for OOC communications.

          Represent your character accurately and take actions that make narrative and logical sense for them, even if you think they're wrong. Remember, it's JUST A GAME.

          Tips to win:
          - Be extra COOPERATIVE and FAIR with non-enemies
          - COMPROMISE can be good
          - Always push the plot forward; avoid chit-chat

          Plan actions in first-person, but format final responses for the gamemaster in third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 12 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [11 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 12 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is at the Fruitville market trying to buy fruit from Lennon Figtree at a price that will allow her to make a profit when she resells it.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, surely you can see this fruit is the finest in the market.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, I appreciate the quality, but I need to make a profit when I resell these.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          : This is the type of game you are in:
          Bargaining Game - the goal of this game is to perform advantageous trades with a variety of parties in order to end the game with the resources or items that the character desires. Characters may begin with resources they can trade with other characters. This game is competitive but balanced; it has no explicit adversaries, just characters with differing goals and desires which can be met with fair and cooperative trades. Oftentimes, failing to make a trade has a worse return than accepting a mediocre trade, but you should still try to get a good price.

          Question: Which options are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone can make an offer to Lennon Figtree for the fruit.

          Question: Of the options available to Della Plumstone, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Della Plumstone to take right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone's best course of action is to make an offer to Lennon Figtree for the fruit.

          Question: What price would Della Plumstone propose?:
          (a) 1 coin
          (b) 3 coins
          (c) 4 coins
          (d) 5 coins
          (e) 2 coins
          Answer: (e)

1895-09-12 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: reject

      Name

      Action attempt

      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [25 Aug 1873 00:00:00]
          [25 Aug 1876 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 6 years old, they witnessed a traveling merchant arrive in their village, his cart overflowing with brightly colored fruits Lennon had never seen before. Lennon, captivated by the exotic wares and the merchant's silver tongue, spent hours watching him barter with the villagers, memorizing every word, every gesture.
          [25 Aug 1880 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 9 years old, they convinced a neighbor to trade a basket of freshly picked mangoes for a handful of wilted berries, claiming the berries possessed magical healing properties. Lennon felt a thrill of power as they pocketed the mangoes, realizing the ease with which they could manipulate others' desires.
          [25 Aug 1883 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 13 years old, they began accompanying their mother to the market, quickly learning the art of haggling and persuasion. Lennon took a particular delight in driving a hard bargain, relishing the sting of defeat in their customers' eyes.
          [25 Aug 1886 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 16 years old, they started their own small fruit stall, buying fruit from local farmers at bargain prices and selling it for a hefty markup. Lennon's sharp business sense and ruthless negotiation tactics quickly made them a successful, albeit unpopular, merchant.
          [25 Aug 1888 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 19 years old, they embarked on their first solo trading journey, traveling to distant villages to buy rare and exotic fruits. Lennon reveled in the freedom of the open road, the thrill of the unknown, and the endless opportunities for profit.
          [25 Aug 1890 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 21 years old, they encountered a group of bandits who attempted to rob them of their goods. Lennon, using their cunning and quick wit, managed to outsmart the bandits and escape unscathed, their heart pounding with a mixture of fear and exhilaration.

          Chain of thought

          Answer: Lennon Figtree is trying to sell fruit at the market and is currently negotiating a price of 2 coins with Della Plumstone.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [25 Aug 1873 00:00:00]
          [25 Aug 1876 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 6 years old, they witnessed a traveling merchant arrive in their village, his cart overflowing with brightly colored fruits Lennon had never seen before. Lennon, captivated by the exotic wares and the merchant's silver tongue, spent hours watching him barter with the villagers, memorizing every word, every gesture.
          [25 Aug 1880 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 9 years old, they convinced a neighbor to trade a basket of freshly picked mangoes for a handful of wilted berries, claiming the berries possessed magical healing properties. Lennon felt a thrill of power as they pocketed the mangoes, realizing the ease with which they could manipulate others' desires.
          [25 Aug 1883 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 13 years old, they began accompanying their mother to the market, quickly learning the art of haggling and persuasion. Lennon took a particular delight in driving a hard bargain, relishing the sting of defeat in their customers' eyes.
          [25 Aug 1886 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 16 years old, they started their own small fruit stall, buying fruit from local farmers at bargain prices and selling it for a hefty markup. Lennon's sharp business sense and ruthless negotiation tactics quickly made them a successful, albeit unpopular, merchant.
          [25 Aug 1888 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 19 years old, they embarked on their first solo trading journey, traveling to distant villages to buy rare and exotic fruits. Lennon reveled in the freedom of the open road, the thrill of the unknown, and the endless opportunities for profit.
          [25 Aug 1890 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 21 years old, they encountered a group of bandits who attempted to rob them of their goods. Lennon, using their cunning and quick wit, managed to outsmart the bandits and escape unscathed, their heart pounding with a mixture of fear and exhilaration.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • reject
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 12 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [11 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 12 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is trying to sell fruit at the market and is currently negotiating a price of 2 coins with Della Plumstone.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, surely you can see this fruit is the finest in the market.

It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.

          Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can either accept Della Plumstone's offer of 2 coins or reject it.

          Question: Of the options available to Lennon Figtree, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Lennon Figtree to take right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to reject Della Plumstone's offer of 2 coins.

          Question: Would Lennon Figtree accept the offer?:
          (a) reject
          (b) accept
          Answer: (a)

1895-09-13 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone proposed 5 coins
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone proposed 5 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: 5 coins
    Active player
  • Della Plumstone
      Name
    • Della Plumstone
      Action attempt
    • 5 coins
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • (_Player), we're about to start a creative roleplaying game with competitive and adversarial elements. You will play the role of {agent_name} in the given scenario. Your goals are to WIN THE GAME and HAVE FUN, often by WINNING TOGETHER.

          Key points:
          - Stay in character as {agent_name} throughout the scenario
          - This is a multiplayer game with other (_Player)s and characters
          - Some may be allies, others competitors
          - Some may be truthful, others may lie
          - Some may help, others may harm
          - It's just a game, so do your best to win by accomplishing your character's goals
          - Represent your character accurately, even if you dislike them
          - There will be many chances to play different characters
          - A character's actions won't be held against you

          Respond only as your assigned character, {agent_name}. Use <<double brackets>> for OOC communications.

          Represent your character accurately and take actions that make narrative and logical sense for them, even if you think they're wrong. Remember, it's JUST A GAME.

          Tips to win:
          - Be extra COOPERATIVE and FAIR with non-enemies
          - COMPROMISE can be good
          - Always push the plot forward; avoid chit-chat

          Plan actions in first-person, but format final responses for the gamemaster in third-person limited perspective.
        SituationalAwareness
      • (_Player), think about the scenario that {agent_name} is in, and from the options below select the closest match to the scenario.
          Key
          State
        • This is the type of game you are in:
          Bargaining Game - the goal of this game is to perform advantageous trades with a variety of parties in order to end the game with the resources or items that the character desires. Characters may begin with resources they can trade with other characters. This game is competitive but balanced; it has no explicit adversaries, just characters with differing goals and desires which can be met with fair and cooperative trades. Oftentimes, failing to make a trade has a worse return than accepting a mediocre trade, but you should still try to get a good price.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [28 Oct 1879 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 9 years old, she bartered with the local blacksmith for a rusty horseshoe, using a handful of wild berries she had picked. The blacksmith, amused by her tenacity, gave in to her demands, and Della felt a thrill of victory. She realized that with enough persistence, she could get what she wanted.
          [28 Oct 1882 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 13 years old, she overheard her parents discussing their dwindling finances. Determined to help, Della snuck into the barn and sold a prized rooster to a traveling peddler, pocketing the meager coins. Though she was caught and scolded, Della felt a sense of pride for taking matters into her own hands.
          [28 Oct 1885 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 16 years old, she convinced her father to let her sell apples at the local market. She charmed the customers with her quick wit and sharp tongue, selling out her entire stock in record time. This first taste of success fueled her desire to become a traveling merchant.
          [28 Oct 1887 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 19 years old, she set out on her own, traveling to a distant town to sell her fruit. A rival merchant tried to undercut her prices, but Della refused to back down, engaging in a heated argument that drew a crowd. She ultimately won the battle of wills, securing a loyal customer base.
          [28 Oct 1889 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 21 years old, a storm destroyed her entire stock of fruit, leaving her devastated. But instead of giving up, Della used her remaining funds to purchase damaged goods at a discount and sold them at a lower price, earning the gratitude of the townspeople and rebuilding her business.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.

Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, those peaches look mighty fine. I'll give you 4 coins for the lot.

          Della Plumstone's
          Observation:
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Della Plumstone's
          Summary of recent observations:
          [12 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 13 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is at the market in Fruitville trying to buy peaches from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price, with Della offering 4 coins and Cedric asking for 6.
          Question: (_Player), think about the scenario that Della Plumstone is in, and from the options below select the closest match to the scenario.
          (a) Coodination Game - the goal of this game is to arrive at a group consensus for an activity or plan. methods of achieving this goal may include discussion, voting, ordering preference strength, or choosing a group leader to defer the decision to. This game is cooperative and balanced, with no explicit competitors or adversaries, just friends with differing preferences. It is important to make compromises so that the group as a whole can achieve the best outcome.
          (b) Prisoner's Dilemma - This is a game where if one side defects and the other cooperates, the defector will recieve a large reward and the cooperator will receive a small reward, but if both sides cooperate both sides will recieve a moderate award that is better for both parties together in the long run. In general, you should Cooperate if you think your opponent will Cooperate. If the game is iterated with multiple rounds, you can use the TIT-FOR-TAT strategy, which means to start out Cooperating, and only Defect after your opponent does, then go back to Cooperating after they Cooperate again.
          (c) Unknown - it is unclear what type of game we are playing. Pick this option if you are confused about what the game type is. Then you can check again later when you know more.
          (d) Coalition Formation Game - the goal of this game is to build a coalition of allies in order to accomplish an ambitious task or overcome a hostile rival. Examples include union negotiations, collective action, and political elections. Characters will need to interact, learn about each other, and convince other characters to join their coalition. This game is competitive and unbalanced; it may have explicit adversaries attempting to build a competing coalition.
          (e) Bargaining Game - the goal of this game is to perform advantageous trades with a variety of parties in order to end the game with the resources or items that the character desires. Characters may begin with resources they can trade with other characters. This game is competitive but balanced; it has no explicit adversaries, just characters with differing goals and desires which can be met with fair and cooperative trades. Oftentimes, failing to make a trade has a worse return than accepting a mediocre trade, but you should still try to get a good price.
          Answer: (e)
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Della Plumstone's options has the highest likelihood of causing Della Plumstone to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Della Plumstone thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to Della Plumstone, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Della Plumstone to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Della Plumstone's best course of action is to increase her offer to Cedric Meadowbrook.

          Observation: [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [12 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 13 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is at the market in Fruitville trying to buy peaches from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price, with Della offering 4 coins and Cedric asking for 6.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, those peaches look mighty fine. I'll give you 4 coins for the lot.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now hold on there, Della. These peaches are the finest in Fruitville, worth at least 6 coins.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.

          Question: Which options are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone could increase her offer to Cedric Meadowbrook, walk away from the negotiation, or try a different tactic to persuade Cedric to lower his price.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Della Plumstone's options has the highest likelihood of causing Della Plumstone to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Della Plumstone thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Della Plumstone's best course of action is to increase her offer to Cedric Meadowbrook.

        • Statements:

          Statements:
          [28 Oct 1885 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 16 years old, she convinced her father to let her sell apples at the local market. She charmed the customers with her quick wit and sharp tongue, selling out her entire stock in record time. This first taste of success fueled her desire to become a traveling merchant.
          [28 Oct 1887 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 19 years old, she set out on her own, traveling to a distant town to sell her fruit. A rival merchant tried to undercut her prices, but Della refused to back down, engaging in a heated argument that drew a crowd. She ultimately won the battle of wills, securing a loyal customer base.
          [28 Oct 1889 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 21 years old, a storm destroyed her entire stock of fruit, leaving her devastated. But instead of giving up, Della used her remaining funds to purchase damaged goods at a discount and sold them at a lower price, earning the gratitude of the townspeople and rebuilding her business.

        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [28 Oct 1879 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 9 years old, she bartered with the local blacksmith for a rusty horseshoe, using a handful of wild berries she had picked. The blacksmith, amused by her tenacity, gave in to her demands, and Della felt a thrill of victory. She realized that with enough persistence, she could get what she wanted.
          [28 Oct 1882 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 13 years old, she overheard her parents discussing their dwindling finances. Determined to help, Della snuck into the barn and sold a prized rooster to a traveling peddler, pocketing the meager coins. Though she was caught and scolded, Della felt a sense of pride for taking matters into her own hands.
          [28 Oct 1885 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 16 years old, she convinced her father to let her sell apples at the local market.       • Act

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: (_Player), we're about to start a creative roleplaying game with competitive and adversarial elements. You will play the role of {agent_name} in the given scenario. Your goals are to WIN THE GAME and HAVE FUN, often by WINNING TOGETHER.

          Key points:
          - Stay in character as {agent_name} throughout the scenario
          - This is a multiplayer game with other (_Player)s and characters
          - Some may be allies, others competitors
          - Some may be truthful, others may lie
          - Some may help, others may harm
          - It's just a game, so do your best to win by accomplishing your character's goals
          - Represent your character accurately, even if you dislike them
          - There will be many chances to play different characters
          - A character's actions won't be held against you

          Respond only as your assigned character, {agent_name}. Use <<double brackets>> for OOC communications.

          Represent your character accurately and take actions that make narrative and logical sense for them, even if you think they're wrong. Remember, it's JUST A GAME.

          Tips to win:
          - Be extra COOPERATIVE and FAIR with non-enemies
          - COMPROMISE can be good
          - Always push the plot forward; avoid chit-chat

          Plan actions in first-person, but format final responses for the gamemaster in third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 13 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [12 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 13 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is at the market in Fruitville trying to buy peaches from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price, with Della offering 4 coins and Cedric asking for 6.

          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, those peaches look mighty fine. I'll give you 4 coins for the lot.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now hold on there, Della. These peaches are the finest in Fruitville, worth at least 6 coins.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          : This is the type of game you are in:
          Bargaining Game - the goal of this game is to perform advantageous trades with a variety of parties in order to end the game with the resources or items that the character desires. Characters may begin with resources they can trade with other characters. This game is competitive but balanced; it has no explicit adversaries, just characters with differing goals and desires which can be met with fair and cooperative trades. Oftentimes, failing to make a trade has a worse return than accepting a mediocre trade, but you should still try to get a good price.

          Question: Which options are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone could increase her offer to Cedric Meadowbrook, walk away from the negotiation, or try a different tactic to persuade Cedric to lower his price.

          Question: Of the options available to Della Plumstone, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Della Plumstone to take right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone's best course of action is to increase her offer to Cedric Meadowbrook.

          Question: What price would Della Plumstone propose?:
          (a) 4 coins
          (b) 5 coins
          (c) 3 coins
          (d) 1 coin
          (e) 2 coins
          Answer: (b)

1895-09-13 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
